body.p: The Edit mode in the WebApp Reviewer allows you not only to review a document but to also make changes to it. You also have the possibility to enable the Track Changes support and record all the edits you make. When you swipe right or press the button, the Actions panel is displayed at the left side of the editing area. This panel lets you enable the track changes support, display the content completion list of proposals, and rename an element.
To activate this mode, tap or click the Edit button in the upper toolbar.

In a desktop web browser, the contextual menu of the Edit mode offers the following actions, along with framework-specific actions:
Undo This action is available in the contextual menu only after you make a change.
Redo This action is available in the contextual menu only after you use the Undo action.
Insert Element Inserts an element at current position.
Rename Element Renames the current element.
Add Comment Allows you to insert a comment on a selected fragment of text.

section.title: Framework Specific Actions
section.p:
Depending on the type of document you are editing, the Edit mode may contain a series of actions defined at framework level. comes with built-in actions for DITA, DocBook, TEI and XHTML. These actions include:
Styling actions Most common styling actions, such as Bold, Italic, Underline.
Insert image Action that allows you to browse for an image and insert it in your document.
Insert paragraph Action that allows you to insert a new paragraph at current cursor position.
List actions Actions that allow you to create ordered and unordered lists, and add new items in them.
Table actions Actions that allow you to create a table and manage its structure (insert and delete rows and columns).
